page.title: 03The Enterprise Zone
page.content: The Enterprise Zone covers a small part of our area to the south.It has been established in order to cut red tape and provide major financial and tax in- centives during the next few years to 1992.The government is presently spend- ing 200 million pounds to help create a modern infrastructure of utilities, transportation and telecommunications in Docklands.Plans include the a new Light Railway,satellite earth stations and a short take off and landing(STOL) airport as well as a new water bus service on the Thames.There are also to be numerous environmental improvements with new recreational and leisure faci- lities.The scale of activity in this new visionary environment of tomorrow, in the heart of a major capital city, proves its potential now as one of the most exciting places to be. Frank MacDonald
